intro: Borreria natalensis, commonly known as Natal borreria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered white or pinkish flowers and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. It is a shrub that typically grows to a height of about 1 meter. Borreria natalensis is adapted to dry conditions and is often used in traditional medicine.
